content: Could I interest someone in reviewing this (non-meta)programming PR? Damiano and I have written an executable that creates Mathlib.lean, Mathlib.Tactic.lean, etc... (it also works in non-mathlib projects).

Just a nit: for command line APIs, the common practice is to use small letters. So lake exe mk_all or lake exe mk-all would make more sense, I think

And supporting this effort, I think it's good to have this Lake script that replaces the current bash script (which I don't think works on Windows out of the box because bash - so the Lake script mitigates that)
mk-all doesn't seem to be valid syntax for the Cli elaborator?
... and I have updated also #11874 that uses lake exe mk_all in CI.

While this discussion is open, there are two libraries that are omitted from the mk_all script:

  • Cache, for which there was a previous thread;
  • LongestPole.

Should LongestPole have a LongestPole.lean file as well?
